resources.string:
What is it?
Revolutions per minute of the engine\'s crankshaft. Indicates how hard the engine is working.

Normal Range:
• Idle (Warm Engine): Approx. 650 - 900 RPM (varies by vehicle).
• Driving: Typically 1500 - 3500 RPM, higher during acceleration.

Abnormal Conditions (at Idle):
• Very Low or Fluctuating (<600 RPM):
Meaning: Engine may stall or run rough. Indicates issues like vacuum leaks, faulty IAC valve, ignition problems (spark plugs, coils), or fuel delivery issues.
Possible DTCs: P0506 (Idle RPM Low), P0300 (Random Misfire)

• Very High (Consistently >1100 RPM):
Meaning: Engine racing unnecessarily. Caused by vacuum leaks, stuck IAC valve, faulty TPS, or incorrect sensor readings.
Possible DTCs: P0507 (Idle RPM High)

Note: Avoid prolonged operation near the engine\'s redline to prevent excessive wear.

What is it?
Temperature of the engine\'s coolant, critical for preventing overheating and ensuring efficient operation.

Normal Operating Range:
Typically 85°C - 105°C (185°F - 221°F) once the engine is warmed up.

Abnormal Conditions:
• Consistently Low (<75-80°C / 167-176°F after warm-up):
Meaning: Engine is not reaching optimal temperature, often due to a thermostat stuck open. Leads to poor fuel economy and increased emissions.
Possible DTCs: P0128 (Coolant Thermostat Temp Below Regulating Temp)

• Consistently High (>110-115°C / 230-239°F - OVERHEATING!):
Meaning: DANGER! Engine is overheating. Stop the vehicle safely immediately. Causes include low coolant, faulty thermostat (stuck closed), fan malfunction, clogged radiator, or water pump failure.
Possible DTCs: P0217 (Engine Overheat), P0117/P0118 (ECT Sensor Circuit Low/High)

What is it?
An estimate of the engine\'s current power output relative to its maximum potential (0-100%).

Normal Range (Varies Greatly):
• Idle: Approx. 10% - 30%
• Cruising: Approx. 20% - 70%
• Acceleration: Can reach 70% - 100%

Abnormal Conditions:
• Unexpectedly Low (During Acceleration):
Meaning: Potential loss of power. May indicate sensor issues (e.g., MAF, MAP, TPS) or reduced engine performance.
Possible DTCs: P0101 (MAF Range/Performance), P0068 (MAP/TPS Correlation)

• Consistently High (During Normal Driving):
_nbsp;Meaning: Engine is under excessive strain. Could be due to mechanical drag (e.g., binding brakes), transmission issues, or the vehicle being underpowered for the conditions.

What is it?
Temperature of the air entering the engine\'s cylinders. Used by the ECU for fuel and ignition calculations.

Normal Range:
Generally close to or slightly above the ambient (outside) air temperature. Can be higher when stationary due to engine bay heat.

Abnormal Conditions:
• Illogically Low or High (Compared to Ambient):
Meaning: Likely a faulty IAT sensor or wiring issue.
Possible DTCs: P0112 (IAT Sensor Circuit Low), P0113 (IAT Sensor Circuit High)

• Consistently Very High (Even When Moving):
Meaning: May reduce engine performance as the ECU might retard timing to prevent knock. Could be due to heat soak or poor sensor placement/shielding.

What is it?
Measures the mass (amount) of air entering the engine, usually in grams per second (g/s). Critical for the ECU to deliver the correct amount of fuel.

Normal Range (Varies by Engine Size/RPM):
• Idle: Approx. 2 - 10 g/s (smaller engines lower, larger engines higher).
• Under Load: Increases significantly with RPM and throttle (can exceed 100 g/s).

Abnormal Conditions:
• Lower Than Expected (for given RPM/Load):
Meaning: Restricted air intake. Possible causes: clogged air filter, vacuum leak (after MAF sensor), dirty or faulty MAF sensor.
Possible DTCs: P0101 (MAF Range/Performance), P0102 (MAF Circuit Low), P0171 (System Too Lean - if not enough air is reported)

• Higher Than Expected:
Meaning: Rare. Usually indicates a MAF sensor fault or an unmetered air leak before the MAF sensor (less common).
Possible DTCs: P0103 (MAF Circuit High)

What is it?
Indicates the health of your car\'s battery and charging system. This is typically the voltage at the vehicle\'s control module.

Engine OFF:
• Normal Range: Approx. 12.0V - 12.8V
Meaning: Battery has a good resting charge.

• Low Abnormal (<11.9V):
Meaning: Weak battery, low charge, or parasitic drain. May cause starting issues.
Action: Check battery age, look for drains, or have battery tested.

Engine RUNNING:
• Normal Range: Approx. 13.2V - 14.8V
Meaning: Charging system (alternator) is working correctly and charging the battery.

• Low Abnormal (<13.0V Consistently):
Meaning: Alternator may not be charging properly. Battery is discharging.
Action: Warning! Risk of vehicle stalling. Check alternator, belts, connections immediately.
Possible DTCs: P0562 (System Voltage Low)

• High Abnormal (>15.0V Consistently):
Meaning: Overcharging! Can damage battery and vehicle electronics.
Action: Caution! Check voltage regulator (often part of alternator).
Possible DTCs: P0563 (System Voltage High)

Note: These are general guidelines. Specific values may vary slightly by vehicle.
For a more reliable connection please select your vehicles model
